data.title: New York Magazine
data.meta_description: See an archive of all hearst stories published on the New York Media network, which includes NYMag, The Cut, Vulture, and Grub Street.
data.text:
return to office Apr. 15, 2022

What If the Office Isn’t the Problem?The debate taking place right now isn’t exactly where the worker is being called back — but to what.

resignations July 23, 2020

Hearst President Troy Young Has Resigned Following New York Times ReportThe report accused Young of engaging in creepy, lewd behavior and creating a toxic work environment.

coronavirus Mar. 23, 2020

Fashion Magazines, in Lockdown, Consider Their FutureAn industry in flux confronts further changes.

how i get it done July 1, 2019

Hearst Chief Content Officer Kate Lewis Recommends Throwing Out Your To-Do List“I figure everything I can remember is what I really have to do, and everything else is kind of bullshit.”

media Aug. 3, 2018

Joanna Coles Is Reportedly Leaving HearstShe is reportedly stepping down as chief content officer.

how i get it done July 3, 2018

How I Get It Done: Joanna Coles, Chief Content Officer at Hearst Magazine“I’m not terribly interested in relaxing. What am I going to do, sit around?”

magazines Oct. 27, 2017

Elle Canceled Its January Cover, Shot by Terry RichardsonThe magazine decided to re-shoot Zoë Kravitz.

cover girls Feb. 21, 2017

Hijab-Wearing Yeezy Model Halima Aden Covers the New Issue of CR Fashion BookParis Jackson also scored a cover.

partners in crime Nov. 21, 2016

Hearst Brings Carine Roitfeld Further Into the FoldThe company will publish her title, CR Fashion Book, on its digital platform.

promotions Sept. 6, 2016

Cosmo Editor-in-Chief Joanna Coles Is Becoming the Anna Wintour of HearstShe will now be the media company’s chief content officer.

revolving door Aug. 22, 2016

Report: Seventeen EIC on Maternity Leave FiredTan had been at the magazine for about two years.

chasing paper Aug. 29, 2013

Breaking: The Fashion Industry Is Underpaid Is anyone surprised?

intern wars May 31, 2013

Meet the Latest Unpaid Fashion Intern Suing Her Former BossErica van Rabenswaay, who filed charges against Norma Kamali this week, tells her story.

intern wars May 9, 2013

Unpaid Intern Lawsuit Thrown OutThe great intern uprising cannot be a class action lawsuit.

ins and outs Mar. 15, 2013

Cosmo Brings on New Fashion DirectorAnd one thing’s for sure: She’s a fan of fur hats.

scandal-stained wretches Mar. 14, 2013

Sexting Stripper Extortion Scandal Hits HearstAccording to “Page Six.”

ins and outs Dec. 14, 2012

Elle Hires Carmen Borgonovo and Lori GoldsteinAs consulting editor and fashion editor-at-large, respectively.

lawsuits Dec. 4, 2012

Hearst’s Lawyers Now E-mailing Former Unpaid InternsTo collect “stories” for their defense.

ins and outs Nov. 16, 2012

Joanna Coles Lays Off Nine Cosmo StaffersShe’ll announce their replacements “shortly.”

carine! Oct. 11, 2012

Carine Roitfeld Joins Hearst at Harper’s BazaarShe’ll be the new “global fashion director.”

person of interest Sept. 11, 2012

The Norma Rae of Fashion InternsMeet Diana Wang, the unpaid intern suing Harper’s Bazaar.

ins and outs Sept. 4, 2012

Joanna Coles Replaces Kate White at Cosmopolitan Magazine [Updated]And Anne Fulenwider succeeds Coles.

lawsuits July 27, 2012

loose threads July 19, 2012

NYC Fashion Fellows Launches; Stella McCartney Announces Fashion ScholarshipPlus, Beyoncé’s new perfume ad drops.

ink-stained wretches Feb. 1, 2012

The Interns Are Organizing!And suing.

things that are not printed on paper Dec. 2, 2011

Hearst Projects 1 Million Digital Subscribers by the End of 2012Unless that potentially pesky Mayan apocalypse gets in the way, of course.

elle watch Dec. 27, 2010

Hearst May Not Be Buying Elle After AllGermany’s Bauer Publications made another offer.

loose threads Dec. 2, 2010

Hearst Is Reportedly Looking to Buy Elle; Ferragamo Wants You to Monogram Your StilettosAlso, Maryna Linchuk has four hands on the December cover of Turkish ‘Vogue.’

school daze Nov. 19, 2010

The Nominated Chancellor of the Largest School System in America Has ‘No Governmental, Political, or Diplomatic Expertise’Other facts about Cathleen Black: She likes yellow taxi cabs and $47,600 bracelets.

ink-stained wretches June 16, 2010

Oprah Gives iPads, $10,000 to Every O StafferThat is a thing that happened. Today.

ink-stained wretches Apr. 20, 2010

Hearst Names Jill Herzig Editor of RedbookShe’ll take over from outgoing editor Stacy Morrison.

ink-stained wretches Apr. 6, 2010

Editorial Shuffle at Town & Country and House BeautifulPamela Fiori, who’s edited the title for seventeen years, is out.

ink-stained wretches Feb. 1, 2010

Hearst to Launch HGTV Magazine?Following in the footsteps of the impressive ‘Food Network Magazine,’ Hearst could find its way back into the shelter category with this title.

rumor mill Oct. 12, 2009

Is Condé Nast Going to Buy Elle While W Gets Cut Down?The rampant rumors are flying, but are any of them actually true? We’re skeptical.

media deathwatch June 1, 2009

Communications-School Graduates Receiving Grim MessagesBasically, at Syracuse and Berkeley, they’re being told they’ll have to work for free.

media deathwatch Apr. 17, 2009

media deathwatch Mar. 25, 2009

Hachette Can No Longer Afford to Keep Boating AfloatSo they’re shipping it off before it sinks. (Sorry.) And more, in today’s media news.

media deathwatch Feb. 25, 2009

Profits at the Washington Post Are Down 77 PercentAnd more grim news from the struggling media industry.

ink-stained wretches Jan. 22, 2009

Teen Magazine to FoldOf Hearst’s teen-mag collection, only ‘Seventeen’ survives.

media deathwatch Jan. 12, 2009

Media Wins Some Battles Against DeathIt’s a good day in the world of words.

ink-stained wretches Oct. 29, 2008

More Media Holiday Parties Get AxedWhat will we crash this year??

Oct. 23, 2008

‘Harper’s Bazaar’ Makes CutbacksThose include layoffs. They already closed California sales offices.

office-party patrol Oct. 17, 2008

Hearst Cancels Holiday PartyUgh, now we’re going to have to crash the Condé Nast holiday party. And we’re always the only ones there who eat the food.

TV on the Magazine Oct. 7, 2008

Food Journalism Sept. 8, 2008

Hearst, Food Network Birth Fat MagazineDesigned around a cavalcade of Food Network stars, Hearst is hedging by including Bobby Flay, Guy Fieri, AND Paula Deen in the same publication.
